reviews.text: I stayed here before flying off next morning. The room overlooked the main road and despite additional glazing it led to a difficult night's sleep due to passing traffic. Air con would also help as the basic but comfortable room was very warm. Staff were pleasant. Parking was very limited.
reviews.title: Hot and Noisy

reviews.text: I regularly spend a night at Edinburgh airport Travel Lodge every 2 to Three weeks. The staff are very friendly and attentive and I am made extremely welcome. The food is good, the surroundings are clean and inviting and the rooms are very comfortable have recently been upgraded to a very high standard indeed. I would recommend this highly to anyone either for business or pleasure. A shuttle taxi service to the airport is available at reasonable cost.
reviews.title: Edinburgh Airport Travel lodge -Home from Home

reviews.text: Very near Edinburgh Airport and excellent for an overnight stay before early morning flight. The room was clean and comfortable, staff welcoming and our meal was hot and tasty. Excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Excellent overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: booked a room well in advance for going to after arrive from my holiday for me and my boyfriend, we got put in a disabled room with 2 single beds, only got 1 towel, room didn't even have a remote(only a problem since it's a disabled room) the door handle/door rattled very loudly as soon as anything went past the building or someone walked past, and considering it's located on a busy road it was very often, which left for one of the worst sleeps we've ever had, which caused us to leave early as it was so annoying, also when people were walking upstairs it cause things in the room to make a noise as well, then the cleaner started hoovering before 9 in the morning waking us up again, shocking, will not be returning, would rather pay extra for something better.
reviews.title: Sleepless night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is bright and airy and either recently refurbished or relatively new. The disabled rooms even have roll in showers which shows that even Travelodge move with the times. Disabled parking is right outside the entrance, but a tour bus took up 2 of the spaces and the others were parking in by non Blue Badge holders. It looks like the car park is way too small for the hotel. The rooms were extremely clean, and beds and bed linen fresh. A single plastic chair was all that was provided to sit on and this was extremely uncomfortable after a very short time.
reviews.title: Hotel OK, Restaurant most definitely not

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel really is ideal for those with a car needing cheap parking before or after a late/early flight. My only complaint is the heat. The windows don't really open (one inch max. "for your security") and there is no air conditioning. Normally this is not a problem in Scotland, but this year it was. Impossible to have a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Excellent location but no ventilation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A short review:
reviews.title: Great value for money but too hot.

reviews.text: Travellodge is in general great value for the money. Nice rooms, beds, bathrooms.
reviews.title: Too Hot

reviews.text: On this stay however the room was so hot that it became quite uncomfortable. It should be possible to open the window a bit more so fresh air can come in to the room.
reviews.title: Convenient, inexpensive and that's it.

reviews.text: The hotel was nice and clean but the bedroom was so hot that we (incl. our 4 and 2 year old) were physically sweating and none of us could sleep. No fans or air conditioning available and we were advised that the building was built to retain heat which isn't good when we finally get a nice Scottish summer and the sun is shining.
reviews.title: Rooms far too hot!

reviews.text: We booked for our 1 am arr from Tenerife. I write this in warning to families. Our room was unbearably over-heated. Despite sympathy from the night staff, there was nothing that could be done - the window could not be opened more than an inch, there were no fans, no air conditioning. It was excruciating, impossible to sleep - a real nightmare with kids of four and seven. I understand we are far from alone in this experience. Left feeling room was mis-sold. Couldn't leave quickly enough
reviews.title: Nightmare experience at Edinburgh airport Travelodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About 1.5 miles from airport, with bus shuttle available at small cost. Care is required when parking since the hotel has limited spaces and the remaining spaces are allocated to the nearby offices and carry a fine for unauthorised parking.
reviews.title: Close to airport

reviews.text: The receptionist was friendly and provided key information on the hotel and services available.The Room was clean with secondary glazing to remove main road traffic and airport noise.Kettle for tea/coffee making available but no hair dryer in the room for the wife, but available from reception upon request.
reviews.title: Clean, modern, functional budget hotel. Be aware of possible noise from corridor.

reviews.text: The matteress on the king size bed ensured no back pain
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here

reviews.text: The hotel has a busy bar and cafe to chill out after a long journey.
reviews.title: Convenient, comfortable and Inexpensive

reviews.text: Don't stay here unless you like sleeping in an oven. Perhaps in winter it will be better, but in summer it is way too hot for most people. (I was told I was in the cooler side).
reviews.title: Too HOT!!!!!!

reviews.text: Perhaps some find it OK, but I certainly heard others complaining about it (and you can read it on Tripadvisor) and the staff are aware of it as are Travelodge HQ, but they don’t seem to wish to address it.
reviews.title: Travelodge Goodbye

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The windows have locks preventing you opening more than 2cm which is a really pity as outside it was nice and cool. The hotel also “dress” the room when you arrive by turning on the light box in the bed head which after it has been on for a while acts like a nice radiator which is just what you don’t need.
reviews.title: surprising hotel
Cheap, if Hot, Bed for the Night
reviews.text: I stayed there at the start of June and the hotel was hot then, it must be much worse now!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fans are not a solution as they just push the hot air around.
reviews.title: Nice Travelodge
